EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]
Platte Chemical Company (Nutrien Ag Solutions) located in Greenville, MS is a toll manufacturer of liquid crop protection chemicals and formulates and packages emulsifiable concentrates and liquid suspension concentrates. Formulations include insecticides, fungicides, and herbicides. The site stores isopropylamine in a quantity over 10,000 pounds.

Accidental Release Prevention Program / Policies and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps [40 CFR 68.155(a,c)]
Process Safety Information (PSI): Written process safety information includes information pertaining to the hazards of the isopropylamine used by the process, information pertaining to the technology of the process, and information pertaining to the equipment in the process.
Process Hazard Analysis (PHA): A process hazard analysis is updated and revalidated every five years to identify, evaluate, and control the hazards involved in the process. Recommendations are resolved and documented in a timely manner.
Operating Procedures:  Written operating procedures have been developed for safely conducting activities consistent with the process safety information for operating steps in each operating phase. Operating procedures are certified annually that they are current and accurate. Safe work practices have also been developed for control of hazards during operations.
Employee Participation: A written plan has been developed regarding the implementation of employee participation. Employees are consulted on the conduct of PHAs and other process safety management elements.
Employee Training: A training program has been developed which ensures employees are trained
on aspects of the processes and on the safe, efficient, and effective performance of their duties.
Contractor Management: Contractors are screened and evaluated on their demonstrated safe work histories before they perform work on or near the isopropylamine process. The site

provides contractor employees with the appropriate safety and health information, ensures they follow facility safe work practices, and periodically evaluates their safety performance.
Pre-Startup Safety Review: A pre-startup safety review is completed by a knowledgeable team of
personnel for isopropylamine projects which are significant enough to require a change in process safety information. The review verifies safety programs are in place, training has been performed, and construction has been completed according to design standards before the project is placed into operation.
Mechanical Integrity: The facility has developed and implemented procedures to ensure the
isopropylamine process is built and maintained using preventive maintenance procedures
to minimize unexpected breakdowns or failures. Maintenance procedures have been developed per
equipment vendor recommendations, federal or state regulations, or industry codes and standards.
Hot Work Permit: The facility has developed and implemented procedures to ensure a signed permit
is obtained prior to any work which could generate a flame, intense heat, or sparks because of
electric or gas welding, cutting, brazing, grinding or similar activities.
Management of Change: The facility has developed and implemented a Management of Change (MOC) program to ensure changes made to the isopropylamine process are properly reviewed, will not result in undetected unsafe situations, and affected employees are made aware of the changes and their implications. The MOC program ensures PSI, maintenance procedures, and operating procedures are updated as necessary to reflect the changes made.
Incident Investigation: The facility has developed and implemented procedures to ensure incidents (and near misses) involving the isopropylamine process are investigated, reviewed, and documented using an investigation team.
Compliance Audits: The facility conducts audits of the prevention program every 3 years (or sooner if needed) to en

sure the program is in place and working properly. The audit team includes persons
knowledgeable in audit techniques and who have the appropriate process knowledge and technical
expertise.

Five-Year Accident History [40 CFR 68.155(d)]
There has not been an accidental release from the covered process containing isopropylamine that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage since the startup of the covered process.

Emergency Response Program and Policies [40 CFR 68.155(a,e)]
The site maintains a detailed Emergency Action Response Plan designed to contact the local emergency response organizations in the event of a hazardous chemical release. This Plan is periodically reviewed with outside emergency response organizations. In the unlikely event of an uncontrolled release, local authorities will be notified and will determine whether an evacuation or shelter-in-place of local areas is warranted.  The local authorities will notify any affected neighbors or surrounding properties of any necessary action.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]
Platte Chemical Company (Nutrien Ag Solutions) is committed to continuous efforts to improve the safe operation of the isopropylamine process by implementing preventative maintenance programs, inspection programs, and employee training in the safe operation of the equipment and the process. The process is designed in accordance with good engineering practices. Periodic auditing of the PSM/RMP Programs ensures process changes or modifications are evaluated and necessary safety precautions and/or safety improvements are made before changes are made.
